channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: A very large pothole down beeches road, 14th February
item.description:
Cars parked on the opposite side so there’s no way of avoiding it. Very large, has damaged my wheel

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Beeches Road, Cheltenham

item.title: This drain has sunken an poses a risk especially to cyclists. It is also blocked an has been for a long time. I noticed 2 other reports on this and these have been closed wit no apparent action taken or explanation why not., 14th February
item.description:
Drain is on lhs approaching swindon village just past swillgate Brook Bridge.

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 14th February
item.description:
Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection. Two bags, one containing general litter and the other cans/plastic bottles for recycling. Bags left on Cheltenham Road, Longlevens opposite Pearman Briggs Caravans. Next to dog waste bin 0273.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester

item.description:

item.title: Chewed up verge making pavement dodgy, 14th February
item.description:
Between turning left out of Grangefield primary school and the entrance to The Highgrove. Road needs double yellows to stop inconsiderate parking on the school run. Grass verge destroyed leaving narrow pavement which is muddy/slippery. Not room for two buggies to pass at one, not helped by first house whose ivy overhangs a long way

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Voxwell Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water covering pedestrian crossing, 14th February
item.description:
Water covering pedestrian crossing and not draining. It’s making it hard for people to cross without going through the water. This has been an issue for ages, why hasn’t a drain been installed there?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Kingsditch lane approaching the McDonald's roundabout, pothole in RH lane, 14th February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Opposite number 1, 14th February
item.description:
The road is breaking up all down the field side of Criftycraft Lane, which is difficult to avoid going around parked cars. However directly opposite number 1 under the large ash tree is a large, deep pothole which could cause damage to tires and wheels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Criftycraft Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: The footpath past the driveway is sunken, 14th February
item.description:
Footpath past the entrance to 50 Hatherley Road is Sunken evidence of past repairs , is worsening. Have seen people trip, all cars access img property catch underside on edge Issue present since at least 2020, but has worsened over the past few months - traps water and debris is a slip hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Hatherley Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
